title.native: ツンデレ悪役令嬢リーゼロッテと実況の遠藤くんと解説の小林さん
title.romaji: Tsundere Akuyaku Reijou Liselotte to Jikkyou no Endou-kun to Kaisetsu no Kobayashi-san
title.english: Endo and Kobayashi Live! The Latest on Tsundere Villainess Lieselotte

description:
Endo and Kobayashi love to bicker about their latest video game fixation. They think they're simply providing color commentary, but one of the game’s characters, Siegwald, can hear them talking about his fiancée, the villainess Lieselotte!

(Source: HIDIVE)
synonyms: นางร้ายสุดซึน ลีเซล็อตเต กับขบวนการพลิกลิขิตสู่ชีวิตแฮปปี้เอนด์
Lieselotte la perfida tsundere e la cronaca in diretta di Endo e Kobayashi

tags.name: Villainess
tags.description: Centers around or prominently features a villainous noble lady.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Video Games
tags.description: Centers around characters playing video games.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Ojou-sama
tags.description: Features a wealthy, high-class, oftentimes stuck up and demanding female character.

tags.name: Josei
tags.description: Target demographic is adult females.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Yandere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is obsessively in love with another, to the point of acting deranged or violent.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Otaku Culture
tags.description: Centers around the culture of a fanatical fan-base.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Adoption
tags.description: Features a character who has been adopted by someone who is neither of their biological parents.

tags.name: Royal Affairs
tags.description: Features nobility, alliances, arranged marriage, succession disputes, religious orders and other elements of royal politics.

tags.name: Arranged Marriage
tags.description: Features two characters made to marry each other, usually by their family.

tags.name: Marriage
tags.description: Centers around marriage between two or more characters.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Reincarnation
tags.description: Features a character being born again after death, typically as another person or in another world.

node.description:
**Alma Mater:** Liverpool Institute for Performing Arts (BA Music)

[Website](https://tatsumusic.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/tatsu_saiki) | [SoundCloud](https://soundcloud.com/tatsuyan)
Washio is a mechanical designer. Graduated from Tokyo Design College. His favourite animation is The Powerpuff Girls.

__[Website](http://dazbee.net/) | [Fan Club](https://dazbee-fc.com/) | [Profile (Universal Music Japan)](https://www.universal-music.co.jp/dazbee/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/nicodaZzz/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/@Dazbeeee/) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/1m0fLOy3wFNcSpwKn75qJz)__

DAZBEE is a South Korean utaite who is known for singing in both Korean and Japanese. She began her career at the age of 15 by releasing covers of VOCALOID songs under the name Dazkin (ダズキン), although it has now been changed.
Affiliated with Beijing Xiele Art Co Ltd
